qas.question: What school does not include the Mahayava scriptures in its canon?
The modern Theravada school stablished itself in what country?
What Mahayana related label is considered derogatory?

context: Only <a0_0>the Theravada<a0_0/> school does not include the Mahayana scriptures in its canon. As the modern Theravada school is descended from a branch of Buddhism that diverged and established itself in <a1_0>Sri Lanka<a1_0/> prior to the emergence of the Mahayana texts, debate exists as to whether the Theravada were historically included in the <a2_0>hinayana<a2_0/> designation; in the modern era, this label is seen as derogatory, and is generally avoided.
